summary: This is a May 20, 2021 letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office for the Southern District of New York to defense counsel in the case of United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell, transmitting discovery materials including Interlochen records and native 'carved' image files from numerous electronic devices. The letter confirms the materials are governed by a protective order and are designated as confidential.

events.title: Prior Discovery Production
events.description: The government previously produced images in PDF format to the defense on this date.

events.title: Protective Order Issued
events.description: A protective order was issued in the case governing the handling of discovery materials.

events.title: Discovery Production Letter
events.description: The U.S. Attorney's Office transmits a new batch of discovery materials, including Interlochen records and native image files from devices, to Maxwell's defense team.

locations: The Silvio J. Mollo Building, One Saint Andrew's Plaza, New York, New York 10007
Interlochen (referenced in 'Interlochen records', likely Interlochen Center for the Arts)
keyFacts: The document is a formal discovery production letter from the U.S. Attorney's Office to Ghislaine Maxwell's defense attorneys.
The production includes 'Interlochen records' and native 'carved' image files from at least 22 different electronic devices (e.g., NYCO24321, NYCO27910).
All produced materials are designated as 'confidential' under a July 31, 2020 protective order.
The letter indicates the government's ongoing discovery obligations in the case United States v. Ghislaine Maxwell (20 Cr. 330).
The mention of 'Interlochen records' suggests potential evidence or connections related to the Interlochen Center for the Arts.
